articles.title: About this blog and its author
articles.description: Read below (if interested) for the background of the author and motivation for this blog
articles.contents:
Konstantinos Patelis


Credit Risk Analytics & Stress Testing


   






Hey there! My name is Konstantinos Patelis, welcome to my blog!
Originally from Athens, I finished my studies in Mechanical Engineering at the National Technical University of Athens, where I received my Master‚Äôs equivalent diploma in 2015. One year later I moved to Zurich to study Management and Economics at ETH and in 2017 I started working in the risk analytics space. Currently, I‚Äôm working in credit risk analytics focusing on combined stress testing.
I started using the R statistical language when working on my thesis at ETH to both analyse the data and apply a modeling strategy, as well as write the entire documentation. Since then I have enjoyed using it in my day to day work to implement solutions that can significantly improve my team‚Äôs efficiency and productivity on our various workflows. One of the purposes of this blog is to showcase tools to replace traditional software used in enterprises in order to automate common tasks and unlock potential for value creation. In fact, even this blog was built using R and the distill üì¶.
When not working or doing other R related stuff, I enjoy watching movies and good animated shows, playing board or computer games with friends, and recently making puzzles.

            Thesis Title: ‚ÄúThe effects of immigration reform on the health sector - Evidence from Switzerland‚Äù

            Contributing to key senior management and regulatory deliverables

            Improved reporting efficiency by 90% through VBA automation
